intro: Monelasmum bolamense, commonly known as the Bolam's spurge, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually opposite and ovate. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species within its native range.
